game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game implements the main controller that will call for the initialization of all our starting variables and contains the main logic for the game loop

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      default constructor to create a game object default to player vs player mode if called
      Game(boolean specifyAIStatus)
      The main constructor that will initialize the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        default constructor to create a game object default to player vs player mode if called

      • Game

        public Game(boolean specifyAIStatus)
        The main constructor that will initialize the game. This will ruin the start() method for the current game object
        Parameters:
        specifyAIStatus - - Boolean that signifies whether the game will implement Player vs Player or Player vs AI

    • Method Detail

      • enableAI

        public static void enableAI()
        A toggle that will set the flag which enables the AI

      • getAIStatus

        public static boolean getAIStatus()
        A getter that returns the AI flag's status
        Returns:
        aiStatus Boolean that when true, indicates the AI has been selected

      • getHitSuccess

        public static boolean getHitSuccess()
        Returns a true or false based on whether the attack was successful or not
        Returns:
        hitSuccess True for hit, false for miss and any other scenario

      • setHitSuccess

        public static void setHitSuccess(boolean b)
        setter for hitSuccess
        Parameters:
        b - boolean for resetting hit success each round

      • clearScreen

        public static void clearScreen()
        When ran on unix systems, will clear the console for improved output and management of the text version of the game

      • sleepThread

        public static void sleepThread(int milliseconds)
        When ran, will sleep the current thread for the milliseconds, effectively giving a transition frame
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - - Int of milliseconds to pause execution

      • setupBoard

        public static void setupBoard(Board player1Board,
                              Player player1,
                              Board player2Board,
                              Player player2)
        Will setup the board when Player wishes to manually setup the boards. Contains error checking and validation to ensure the ship's added meet specification
        Parameters:
        player1Board - Board object that stores all of the information of the main player's board
        player2Board - Board object that stores all of the information of the opposing player's board
        player1 - player object linked to player1Board
        player2 - player object linked to player2Board

      • userPlaceShip

        public static void userPlaceShip(Board playerBoard,
                                 Player currentPlayer)
        the main function used for the players to setup their ship placements
        Parameters:
        playerBoard - the Board object of the player setting the ship
        currentPlayer - the current player

      • setupInput

        public static void setupInput(Board board,
                              Player currentPlayer,
                              int shipLength,
                              int shipCount)
        Receives human and text file input, and creates boards based on the given information. Checks implemented to ensure the placements are not outside the scope of the given board
        Parameters:
        board - the current board being set up
        currentPlayer - the current player connected to the board
        shipLength - length of the ship
        shipCount - the current ship being placed

      • winCondition

        public static boolean winCondition(Board board)
        A check that will be ran after every turn. Will scan the current and enemy player's boards for existing ships, and declares a winner if none are found
        Parameters:
        board - - The board the win condition scan will be performed on
        Returns:
        Will return a boolean to indicate whether the win conditions have been met

      • mapFromFiles

        public static void mapFromFiles(java.lang.String mapLevel,
                                Board board)
        Reads from a given file and creates the current board and ship placements based on line-by-line fed information
        Parameters:
        mapLevel - The final that contains the information required to build the level
        board - the board being setup

      • start

        public void start()
        Default board difficulties Use the AI thingy to setup random board placement Implement Ship class features - ship sunk Fix board size constants Starting method that will instantiate all of our variables and begin the game loop

      • startCheck

        public void startCheck()
